title: Hong Kongâ€™s AI Frontier: Caretia Revolutionizes Lung Cancer Screening with Deep Learning Breakthrough
summary: Hong Kong-based Caretia is poised to transform lung cancer diagnostics, leveraging a deep learning breakthrough to revolutionize screening practices. Their new AI-powered system promises to deliver faster and more accurate results, potentially improving early detection rates in the region.

title: AI chatbots often outperform doctors in diagnosis, but need safeguards to avoid overprescribing
summary: Medical Xpress reports on this significant development in AI-assisted diagnostics, marking progress in the field of medical technology and healthcare innovation.

summary: Bioengineer.org reports on this significant development in AI-assisted research, marking progress in the field of medical technology and healthcare innovation.

title: FDA seeks industry feedback on AI medical device safety monitoring
summary: The FDA is actively soliciting input from the medical device industry regarding the safety monitoring of AI-driven devices. This initiative suggests the agency is working to establish clear guidelines and best practices for ensuring the ongoing safe and effective use of AI in medical technology, reflecting a proactive approach to managing potential risks.

title: Merck Maintains Human Touch In AI-Assisted Patient Recruitment And Education
summary: Merck is prioritizing the human element in its patient care strategy, even as it integrates artificial intelligence. The company is specifically using AI to enhance patient recruitment and education efforts, ensuring these processes retain a personalized and empathetic approach. This strategy suggests a commitment to balancing technological innovation with traditional patient-centered values.

title: BMS and Takeda dive into AI data pool, joining peers in collaborative push to unfold the future
summary: Bristol Myers Squibb and Takeda are the latest pharmaceutical giants to leverage artificial intelligence and big data in drug discovery and development. Joining a growing trend within the industry, the partnership aims to unlock new insights and accelerate the future of medicine through collaborative data analysis.

title: AI & ML in Clinical Trials Fundamentals, Applications, and Regulatory Aspects Training Course: Driving Innovation in How Research is Designed, Conducted and Evaluated (Nov 6, 2025) - ResearchAndMarkets.com
summary: A November 2025 training course will explore the fundamentals, applications, and regulatory aspects of AI and machine learning in clinical trials, focusing on how these technologies are reshaping research design, execution, and evaluation. The course, announced by ResearchAndMarkets.com, promises to drive innovation within the medical imaging field by providing crucial insights into this rapidly evolving area.

title: An interpretable hybrid deep learning framework for gastric cancer diagnosis using histopathological imaging
summary: A new interpretable hybrid deep learning framework shows promise for improving gastric cancer diagnosis using histopathological images. The model combines multiple deep learning techniques to analyze microscopic tissue samples, potentially offering pathologists a more accurate and explainable diagnostic tool.

title: How AI-Driven Platforms Can Transform Clinical Trial Efficiency in Cancer Care
summary: AI platforms are poised to revolutionize cancer clinical trials by streamlining processes and accelerating research timelines. These innovative technologies can enhance patient recruitment, optimize data analysis, and ultimately improve efficiency in developing new cancer therapies.
